resources.string:
PocketCare S uses Bluetooth to enable smartphones to send and receive beacon signals. It checks the distance between a smartphone and another beacon (or smartphone running the same app) to see if they are within 2 meters from each other, and if so, the smartphone records the duration of such a close encounter with another beacon.

It provides each user with social distance information such as the number of other users who have been in close proximity with the user on a hourly and daily basis. It also reports to the user the duration of the close encounter sessions the user was involved, and alerts the user if the duration of the current session exceeds a certain threshold.

For administrators of an organization (whose members adopt PocketCare S), social distance information aggregated over all of its member users such as the total number and duration of close encounters in the workplace will be made available through an analytics dashboard, which responds to queries such as “what is the number (or the percentage) of the users who have had more (or less) than “x” number (or minutes) of close encounters?”.  Such information will empower both users and employers to practice and encourage good social distancing in the workplace.

PocketCare S is built upon a previous application, called PocketCare, developed five years ago by University at Buffalo (UB) faculty and students track the flu/virus propagation, and used by many volunteers. The new PocketCare S is the second generation of PocketCare, where “S” also stands for “Social distance”.

For more information visit PocketCare S website.

Data Collection and Privacy Policy

The App does not collect any specific information about you. In other words, all the data collected is anonymous and will not reveal any private personal information.

The app collects anonymous ids of the beacons encountered, and estimates the duration of each close encounter session. Each smartphone randomly generates and frequently changes its anonymous id to be advertised to other smartphones to further protect privacy. Although the app requires the GPS to be turned on in order to determine if a close encounter with another beacon occurs on a campus or not, no GPS information is collected. Users are encouraged, but are not required, to provide a daily, anonymous health monitoring report, and other anonymous profile information such as age groups, zip code, gender and ethnicity.

Some anonymized data collected will be stored in a secure server. Based on the anonymous data, the server will aggregate the information on the number and duration of close encounters on campus from all users, and make such aggregated information (instead of information about any particular individual) available to the public.

PocketCare S strictly adheres to the privacy policies reviewed and approved by University at Buffalo Human Research Protection Program (IRB). More information about the data collection, usage, and Privacy Policy and FAQs can be found on our website .

What are usage points used for?

• Granting your levels to unlock features in the feature tab

• Used as very important metric as the chance to win prizes in each raffle cycle

How to earn usage points fast

You earn usage points by running the App with \"Scan service\" turned \"ON\" (this is a default setting) in \"Scan Settings\". Points are calculated based on the number of \"scan\" reports generated by Bluetooth, GPS, WiFi and Activity Recognizer, so higher the frequency you set these interfaces to scan, the faster your points will likely to accumulate. You can also find the daily usage point earning rate based on your current configuration in the \"Scan service\" link.

You also earn points by submitting daily health status report. While we encourage you to update your health status on the same day, you will not earn additional points by submitting health status more than once a day.

Unlocking Features

PocketCare runs a background service to collect the proximity information and ultimately help model how epidemic diseases propagation through close proximity. In order to incentivize individual’s participation, the App is designed with several levels, each with a new feature, all of which help you discover interesting facts on your daily behaviors and your smartphone usage. When you start the App at level one, only the basic feature is available (unlocked). However, as you keep the App running, you will accumulate more and more usage points, and when you reach the next level, a new feature will be unlocked. We plan to continue to develop new features (and please suggest us your suggestions) and release them in future versions of the App.

Features already unlocked

Following is a list of features that are already unlocked to you:
Show your rank of usage point among all other users in each promotion period, which is related to our awarding policy. Please check \"Prizes\" in setting tab for more details.

Show a summary of your yesterday status, including the mileage you have covered, your health status, the number of unique Bluetooth device you have encountered(detected) and the number of unique WiFi access point you have seen
Based on the health status you reported, we give you some health tips and suggestions to help you recover from it :)
Among all the Bluetooth devices you have detected, how many of them are installed with the same application?
Notify the presence of bluetooth dTestevice of your interest if it is in your vicinity. You can designate a bluetooth device and choose time interval between two consective notifications

Plot a graph showing your historical health status. The health score on a scale from 0 to 5 based on your daily health report, 5 for feeling good and for each symptom the score is decreased by 1. If you dont submit health report, health score is 0.
Plot a graph showing a record of your encounters with Bluetooth devices in general, which means any devices with a bluetooth interface(headset, laptop or the ones installed with the same application)
Plot a graph showing the distance you have covered every day
Display a summary of the discovered WiFi Access Points, in a decreasing order of their frequencies
Plot the number of distinct WiFi access point discovered every day
Plot a graph showing historical activity status
Show you a summary of your recovery status based on the health report you submitted

Show aggregate information of your usage history, including the total number of distinct Bluetooth device you have detected, the total number of unique WiFi access point you have discovered, the total number of health report you have submitted and the total mileaged you have travelled

Show your own record for the most, including the Bluetooth device and WiFi access point that you have seen for the most times, the longest recover time based on your health report and the longest distance you have travelled in a single day
Give you information based on health reports from users and users your have encountered
Download your own data locally to this device
There are no more available features at next level from now on :(
This feature is locked at now, upgrade to next level will unlock it! You can find more details about gaining levels and usage points in \"Usage Points\" at setting tab
Select one from the following detected bluetooth devices so that PocketCare will notify you when it is around
Select the time interval between two consective notification when designated BT mac is detected
Following is a list of WiFi Access Points you have discovered sorted based on their frequencies

string-array.name: health_report_group
string-array.item: I have the following symptoms:\n(check all that apply)
Someone I met today was sick

string-array.name: fever_tips
string-array.item: Fever. A fever is a part of the body\'s defense against infection. Although a fever is not an illness, if it exceeds temperatures of 40C (104F), it can become very dangerous. However, for most fevers, there is no option but to ride it out at home.
Take a bath. If you want some relief and a treatment for your fever, go relax in a tub full of cool water. The water will help to cool the skin and will evaporate as you soak, cooling you further.

Sponge down. If a bath doesn\'t sound too appealing, use a moist towel instead. Soak small towels in cool water and dab them over your body. Again, you will benefit from the further cooling by evaporation. Leave a cloth on your forehead to soothe any discomfort caused by the fever.

Lower the room temperature. Reduce the temperature of your home to help keep cool. Lowering the room temperature will likely feel more comfortable and will also help to reduce the temperature of your body. The fan will provide additional cooling and relief.

Remove layers of clothing. Bundling under layers of clothing and blankets traps heat, making a fever last longer than usual. Wear only a 1 layers of clothing and only use a blanket for periods of chills. If in bed, use only a sheet and get rid of the blanket or comforter.

Get lots of rest. Your body is fighting against a sickness and needs plenty of energy to heal itself. Help provide this by limiting activity and resting or sleeping as much as possible. Avoid moving around much and if necessary, take time off of work.

Try an all liquid diet. Nutrients in some foods can feed the bacteria that are causing your illness and the accompanying fever. So, it is best to starve out your sickness by fasting while you have the fever. On the other hand, the antioxidants packed into fruit seem to reduce fevers also. Therefore, fast while the fever persists or flood your body with the anti-oxidants found in most fruits. Both approaches have been shown to reduce the severity of a fever.

Stay hydrated. Along with rest, your body needs plenty of liquids to fight the illness in your body, especially if you are fasting. Drink water frequently throughout the day, supplementing with clear broth and juice, if desired.

Stay indoors. Unless you\'re already outdoors when your fever comes on, it is best to curl up and rest indoors where the air is dry and the temperature won\'t change much. If you must be outdoors while suffering from your fever, stay in the shade and limit activity.

string-array.name: runnynose_tips
string-array.item: Apply pressure. Press down 10 times on the corner of your nose, pressure very gently to keep your nose from getting worse. It is believed that this pressure point can help alleviate sinus congestion and headaches that result from colds and allergies. Your nose should be almost closed each time you apply pressure to the area. Repeat on the area just above your eyes, applying mild pressure. Repeat 10 times on each side of your face.
Massage. Massage your earlobe for 10 seconds. Repeat on both sides.

Irrigate. Use salt water to flush out the nasal passages, freeing up mucus and other debris. You can either use a syringe, neti pot, or other product designed for nasal irrigation. Alternatively, you can gently flush out your nose using water alone, but be sure that the water has either been filtered or previously boiled to make sure it is clean. Be careful not to inhale the water.

Blow your nose. Runny noses result when you have excess mucus and fluid buildup in your nose and throat. The best way to treat a runny nose is to get the excess fluid out. Blow your nose gently, using a soft tissue to avoid skin irritation. Don\'t blow too often, as it could cause skin burning and redness.
Apply a warm compress. Soak a hand towel in hot water and place it on your face. This will help alleviate sinus pressure and open up the nasal passages.

string-array.name: coughing_tips
string-array.item: Drink herbal tea with honey. Get into the habit of having a mug of non-caffeinated tea before bed. \"Any warm liquid can help break up mucus in your airways,\" says Norman H. Edelman, MD, chief medical officer of the American Lung Association. Add a little honey.

Sleep on an incline. When it comes to nighttime cough, gravity is your enemy. All the postnasal drainage and mucus you swallow during the day backs up and irritates your throat when you lay down at night. Try to defy gravity by propping yourself up on some pillows while you sleep.

Use steam cautiously. Dry airways can make your cough worse. You may find relief from taking a shower or bath before bed—or just sitting in a steamy bathroom. Edelman has one caution: \"If you have asthma, steam can actually make a cough worse.\"

Prepare your bedside. In case you start coughing in the night, have everything you need by your bed—a glass of water, cough medicine or drops, and anything else that seems to help. The sooner you can stop a coughing fit, the better. Continually coughing irritates your airways, which can make your nighttime problem last longer.

Keep bedding clean. If you have a cough and are prone to allergies, focus on your bed. Dust mites—tiny creatures that eat dead flakes of skin and lurk in bedding—are a common allergy trigger. To get rid of them, each week wash all your bedding in hot water, Edelman says. You may also want to wrap your mattress and pillows in plastic, as that can keep dust mites from invading.

Consider medicine. Over-the-counter cough medicines can help in two ways. An expectorant can help loosen mucus. A cough suppressant blocks the cough reflex and reduces the urge to cough. Look carefully at the label to make sure you get the medicine that\'s right for your cough. Ask your pharmacist or doctor if you\'re not sure.

See your doctor. If you\'ve had a nighttime cough for longer than 7 days, it\'s time to check in with your doctor. It may take some time, but together, you and your doctor can figure out the cause—and make your nights peaceful again.

Watch the humidity. Humidifiers can help coughs if the air is dry. But too much moisture in your bedroom can keep you coughing, too. Dust mites and mold (both common allergens) thrive in damp air. It is suggested that you keep humidity levels at 40\u0025 to 50\u0025. To measure humidity, pick up an inexpensive device, such as a hygrometer at your hardware store.

string-array.name: sore_tips
string-array.item: Water. Gargle with warm salt water to help reduce swelling and relieve discomfort: Gargle at least once each hour with 1 tsp (5 g) of salt dissolved in 8 fl oz (240 mL) of warm water. If you have postnasal drip, gargle often to prevent more throat irritation.
Prevent dehydration. Fluids may help thin secretions and soothe an irritated throat. Hot fluids, such as tea or soup, may help decrease throat irritation.

Use a vaporizer or humidifier in your bedroom. Warm or cool mist may help you feel more comfortable by soothing the swollen air passages. It may also relieve hoarseness. But don\'t let your room become uncomfortably cold or very damp. Use a shallow pan of water to provide moisture in the air through evaporation if you don\'t have a humidifier. Place the pan in a safe location where no one will trip on it or fall into it.

Use nonprescription throat lozenges. Medicated throat lozenges or sprays have medicine (local anesthetic) that numbs the throat to soothe pain. Hard candy may also help. Think about buying the sugar-free kind.

Use a decongestant or a steroid nasal spray. if you have a stuffy nose (congestion). These medicines make breathing easier by shrinking swollen mucous membranes in the nose, allowing air to pass through. They also help relieve a runny nose and postnasal drip, which can cause a sore throat. These medicines may not be safe for young children or for people who have certain health problems. Before you use them, check the label. If you do use these medicines, always follow the directions about how much to use based on age and in some cases weight.

string-array.name: nausea_tips
string-array.item: Use acupressure. You can do this by applying your thumb to your wrist and pressing for 30 seconds. Your index and middle fingers should be on the top of your wrist.

Fresh air. Get the air flowing. Have a fan blow on your face or body. This will reduce nausea, and will feel quite good. Get away from bad odors. Avoid sitting in hot rooms and avoid repulsive smells—which, when you\'re nauseous, is just about any smell at all.

Non-prescription drugs. Seek relief with non-prescription drugs. Some over-the-counter medications such as Pepto-Bismol, Maalox and Mylanta help calm nauseated stomachs. Others include Emetrol and Nauzene. It depends on the cause of nausea, but an irritated stomach may feel better after a couple of spoonfuls. Anti-motion sickness drugs like Dramamine can also help as well. Some medications can cause nausea as a side effect. Talk to your doctor. Domperidone (sold as Motilium in the UK) works for some people.

Foods that help ease nausea. Eat fiber rich foods. These remove nausea-inducing chemicals from your system. Have an apple or snack on raw vegetables; Snack on peanuts. Nuts and other protein rich foods replenish depleted energy and keep nausea at bay; Eat a banana. Bananas contain potassium that is lost during nauseous symptoms; Have some applesauce. Eat no more than a spoonful or so at a time, until your nausea has abated; Use ginger. Nibble crystallized ginger. Or, make ginger tea by grating fresh ginger, pour boiling water over it, allow to brew, then strain.

Getting your mind off the nausea. Do something fun. Forget about the nausea. Watch a movie or talk to someone. Try playing a video game, listen to songs. Sometimes nausea is only in the mind. Try not to stress about being sick, anxiety can make nausea worse. Read a book, grab a crossword puzzle, or watch a movie!

string-array.name: use_phone_tips
string-array.item: Features will be gradually unlocked to you when you use our application. Unlocked features and next locked feature are displayed in the feature tab.
Introduction of how to unlock features and gain levels can be found in \"Features\" in the setting tab
Accepting our terms to run background service and submit your general information will directly upgrade you to level 1, granting the feature of showing your rank of usage points among all the users
Set a higher scanning frequency will help you get usage points faster
You can adjust interface scan frequency in \"Scan Setting\" from the setting tab
Usage point is a measurement of how much you used our application, it is calculated based on the number of health report and number of interface scans
Every two weeks, the user with the top 3 usage point of that cycle will be guaranteed to win a prize
You can update your information anytime in \"User Information\" in the setting tab
You can turn on tips all the time in \"Preference Setting\"
Old local cache data can be configured when to be uploaded and deleted, check it up in \"Preference Setting\"
Remember to report your health status every day correctly, this gives you a lot of usage points
Check information in \"Prizes\" to learn more details about how we give away cool prizes
Please like our facebook page "PocketCareUB", there is also a lot of useful information there
Do not forget to check our notification dashboard item updated from server in the home tab frequently
You can only earn usage points once from submitting health status every day
You are free to turn on/off scan at night time, note that the scans will not be counted as usage point
You can pull the list in home tab to update its content
Turn off 2G/3G/LTE network data transmission to only allow data traffic through WiFi

If the app stops working, please you hit the \"Report\" button to help us diagnose the problem, the scanning services will automatically resume in the background. You may also start the App manually if you want to access the features and menus etc.

resources.string: Thank you for installing PocketCare. Please read the tips on how to earn points faster to unlock more and more features that will help you discover interesting facts about your smartphone usage and daily behaviors, as well as to enter bi-weekly raffles to win cool prizes during our promotion period. Take care and have fun!
Please select which month of data that you want to download from:
Scanning from bluetooth is binded to proximity service
You have not accepted our terms yet, you can accept it in \"About App\" of setting tab
You have not submitted your general information yet, check \"User Information\" in setting tab
You have not submitted your general information yet, click OK to submit it now or you can submit it from \"User Information\" anytime in setting tab
Please enable network-provided time to make contact measurement more accurate and save battery! You can check it in Android system "Settings" -> "Date & Time" -> "Automatic date & time"
You have not submitted your health report today, click OK to submit it.
The answers to some of the questions are still empty, please return to fill them!
Your have submitted general information before, are you sure that you want to update the old one?
There is no information recorded in local database, please try again later!
Please use the slide bar below to select a number:
You can update your information in \"User information\" from the setting tab anytime you want in the future
Based on the symptoms you selected, you should contact a medical professional immediately!
You reported no symptoms, let’s stay healthy and fit.
Please stay at home and continue to watch your symptoms daily. For more information visit: CDC Website
Tell your roommate to take precautions and maintain appropriate distance from your roommate.
Sanitize your hands and make sure you clean everything after the interaction.
You do not have any health report yet. Please enter your daily health report, it only takes a few seconds.
Take a few seconds to record your health status everyday.
Learn tips and guidelines from health professionals.
Keep track of social distance with other users.

Clean Your Hands Often

Wash your hands regularly with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.

Practice Social Distancing

Avoid close contact with others, keep about 6 feet between yourself and others, stay at home as much as possible.

Cover Your Nose and Mouth

When going out in public, make sure to wear a face cover.

Cover Coughs and Sneezes

Always cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze, and throw the used tissues directly in the trash.

Clean and Disinfect

Clean and disinfect the frequently touched objects daily. This includes tables, doorknobs, light switches, etc.

Stay at Home

Stay in your apartment or residence hall room when you are sick. Avoid any unnecessary travel, and limit shopping trips to those needed for essential supplies.

Monitor your health

Be alert for symptoms. Watch for symptoms including fever, cough, shortness of breath. Monitor your symptoms daily using the health monitor in the app.

PocketCare S, in its current form, is primarily intended to measure social distance. It can assist but is not intended for automating contact tracing operations.

The daily health report in PocketCare S neither provides diagnostic services nor substitutes medical treatment. If you currently feel seriously ill, please seek medical help.

Due to inherent limitations of the smartphone technology used, PocketCare S does not guarantee the information on the number, duration or distance of the close encounters is accurate. The actual values may be above or below the estimated values.
To learn more about &appname;, visit FAQs.

The app generates a randomized Bluetooth name to hide your identity.
The app will automatically change your Bluetooth Name.
Thank you.

string-array.name: ethnic_group
string-array.item: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

resources.string: To protect your privacy, cloaked locations are sent to the server instead of your real locations. You can view the cloaked locations that are sent to the server.

A period of at least 5 minutes during which you are within 2 meters from another is called a close encounter. You will be notified if a close encounter session exceeds 10 minutes. Your close encounters are recorded in a log on your device, with a slight lag for privacy protection purposes. Please check back for updates.

By checking this box, I have read and understood the data collection, usage, and privacy policy as well as the disclaimer, and agree to hold the app developers and their employers harmless for any and all consequences of using the &appname;.
The app uses activity recognition only to conserve your phone\'s battery. Your activity will not be recorded.
Your location information is safely stored only on your phone. Please always allow GPS use.
&appname; requires bluetooth to be turned on to measure social distance.
Sharing the information below is optional but highly encouraged.

On this screen, you can see a list of locations you have visited. The red pins will give you the real information from GPS and the blue pins will give you the corresponding cloaked (masked) location information that will be uploaded to the server.
On this screen, you will see information on close encounters with other &appname; users.
On this screen, you will see all of your daily health reports. We encourage you to enter this information daily. It only takes a few seconds.
Take a few seconds to record health status daily.
&appname; needs bluetooth to be turned on.
&appname; needs location to be turned on.
Your current contact duration has exceeded 10 minutes. Please mind your social distance.
Choose if/how to snooze the Social Distance notifications
